entry.title: Monkeying Around with Python at New Relic
entry.summary:
Description

Monkeying around with Python at New Relic

Presented by Graham Dumpleton

This session will cover the challenges of creating a production application performance monitoring system for Python. It includes an overview of the architecture of the system, as well as how it hooks into Django and captures details about web transactions, database transactions, memcache requests, exceptions and much more.

entry.title: Introduction to Python Database Programming
entry.summary:
Summary

[EuroPython 2011] Marc-Andre Lemburg - 21 June 2011 in "Track Tagliatelle"

Description

The talk will give an introduction to the concepts used in the Python Database API and relational databases in general. Connection, cursors and transactions are discussed, and their use in a typical Python database application are demonstrated. The talk will also touch upon some advanced database programming techniques and discuss best practices.
